mods.abstract: Begins at large mansion, Charles Faulkner Bryan and family at home in Cookeville, Tenn. (:10), Tennessee Tech University marching band outside of engineering building and on field (2:12), Edith exiting dwelling in an elaborate hat (2:48), Bryan family outside of family home in Cookeville, Tenn. (3:39), newborn baby and young girl (Betty Lynn (1941) and Charles, Jr., (1946) unconfirmed) (4:20), family exiting and saying goodbye at dwelling and posing for group picture (4:44), Bryan family visiting his family with newborn infant (6:25), Bryans visit Asheville and Yancey County, North Carolina via train on vacation. Local stores Mooneyham's Pharmacy and Star Store are in the foreground (7:56), young girl waving goodbye outside of dwelling (10:03), damned waterway and mill (10:10), railroad station and post office (10:30), Downtown Asheville, North Carolina (10:45), railroad station and post office (11:02), Bryan family in small town, cooking by a fire (unconfirmed), and in Yancey County, North Carolina at an overlook (14:20), Bryans posing on railroad car (14:00).

titleInfo.title: RG 42 Charles Faulkner Bryan papers, reel film.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Tennessee Technological University. Archives and Special Collections
